@PSYCHOBEVO holy shit I had no idea this happened. That's really interesting, but extremely disappointing, I now understand why Momoa and others cant speak on it too much. Thank you SO much for taking the time and filling me in!

@yuri What happened was director Zack Snyder left Justice League after a personal tragedy and then WB brought onboard Avengers director Joss Whedon to do extensive reshoots. At the time they told us that Whedon was only finishing Snyder's vision for the movie, not changing it. But it turns out that wasn't true. We know by now that the reshoots drastically changed the movie. It's clear the point of the reshoots were to add a bunch of comedy to the movie and cut the movie down in length, removing tons of scenes that Snyder shot. All of Whedon's reshot scenes have a heavily comedic tone, like Avengers. WB obviously wanted to turn Justice League into the Avengers to appease the critics who always give Marvel movies higher ratings. We know that Snyder's cut of the movie before the reshoots was very different because we have a ton of evidence: missing scenes that were in the trailers but not included in the movie, leaked footage, set photos, comments by cast/crew who worked on the movie, etc. And one of the most ridiculous things is that Henry Cavill was shooting Mission Impossible at the time of the reshoots and couldn't shave his moustache, so in all the reshoot scenes, Superman's face looks weird, because they used CGI to remove his moustache, but didn't do a good job. Zack Snyder's cut of the movie is confirmed to have been very close to being finished. He actually finished principal photography on the movie already. That's what fans are asking for when we want to see the Snyder Cut. We want to see the original cut. And it's not just fans, cast members like Jason Momoa and Ray Fisher have spoken up about wanting to see Snyder's Cut.
